name: hollis
text: I found a romance novel in the shared computer room of my dorm that was worse than this. Called His Wicked Ways, it told the story of a Scottish noblewoman kidnapped by a nobleman in an opposing clan who then developed an acute case of Stockholm syndrome. The best part was when instead of shouting, "Yes! Yes!" she moaned "Aye! Aye!"

name: suprememongoose
text: Whoah. I totally found that same book stashed in the laundry room of the apartment complex I lived in 2 summers ago. (It was bad indeed.)

name: delzhand
text: My wife bought a book (on principle) called Pride and Petticoats.  She said it was the worst thing ever.  She took it to class and they staged an impromptu dramatic reading a'la [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Eye_of_Argon]The Eye of Argon[/a].

name: delzhand
text: arg stupid html/bbcode habits

name: stuart
text: I'm actually too lazy to move out of the site frame . The Eye of Argon .

name: carlyle
text: I hope that book is still in print.

name: siolre
text: With or without a working link you get a chubby for this shit being hilarious. Hard to believe I didn't know about it.

name: pogo
text: Thanks for the introduction to "Eye of Aragon," truly one of the funniest pieces of prose I ever set eyes on.

name: i_love_kate
text: Argon, man. The element, not the Tudor queen.

name: mikekitchell
text: I love the fact that you found a romance novel in the shared computer room of your dorm and felt compelled to read it .

name: youfailme
text:
I find it odd that you read it. If I found a book called "His Wicked Ways" I'd think it was a romance novel about a gay pirate and all of his sexcapades.

Come to think of it, I'd probably read it too. That book sounds interesting.

name: tekende
text:
"Argh, we about to show folks jest how gay it can get in this pirate ship," shouted Captain Pinkbeard.

CAPITAL!" the first mate yelled, quaffing another mug of coconut-infused rum. "CAPITAAAAAL!"

name: clever-nickname
text:
Being unfamiliar with romance novels, I called bullshit on the existence of HIs Wicked Ways.

I was Incorrect

name: zem
text:
average rating: 4.5
unattributed quote: "No one can write a book quite like Samantha James."

name: woodenteeth
text: One reader wrote: "I wish my husband was more like Cameron [the kidnapper]". Aaaaaaand we have a direct reference to why these things sell.

name: soticoto
text:
... But some Scottish girls really will do that.

Grounds for instant downgrade, mind you.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I couldn't help myself:

[url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0380805863/ref=sib_dp_srch_pop?v=search-inside&keywords=again this time a soft cry&go.x=15&go.y=9&go=Go%21/]Here[/url]

name: achilleselbow
text: Yea... shoulda known that wouldn't work. If you search for "again this time a soft cry" using the search inside the book feature, you can read the page where this phenomenon occurs. It is truly a marvel.

text:

LAME.

"Nude, he was...SO nude. Nudest he has ever been"

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Dear God, that's hilarious.

name: canusdivinus
text: That's hot.

name: belgand
text: Some friends and I walked into a friend's dorm room once to find an incest porn story on his creepy roomate's computer half-read. The part that made it especially problematic is that he called his sister like every week or so and wore a disturbing amount of leather clothing. Not even anything kinky, just lots of leather.

name: shirt145
text: You... you read this book? That is cold an argument for brain-wipe technology if I ever heard one.

name: capnroblivious
text:
Back when I lived in Houston, I saw the most horrifying thing in the history of... well, ever.

NASCAR-themed Harlequin novels. [url=http://www.eharlequin.com/store.html?cid=600]

name: capnroblivious
text:
Also, I would like to echo a long line of sentiments carried by men far greater than I:

FUCK BBCODE!

name: griffypoo
text: That's one "Aye!" away from being a Power Rangers romance novel.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rowboat, blahhhhhhh, farqussus, mania3)

name: farqussus
text: well duh.

name: suprememongoose
text: I just love the line "A single rose fell from nowhere and landed on the floor with a sound like an angel slapping pudding ." Gold.

name: spinynorman
text: Man, I usually don't chubby people just for parroting lines from the strip, but this is prose so awkward that it is fucking beautiful.

name: suprememongoose
text: I don't normally parrot, but I couldn't pass that line up. If I could work it into my daily speech, I would.

name: invidious
text: Buy more pudding.

name: mnemon
text: What indeed is that sound? Is it a soft 'thwack' or more of a 'plop'...

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mortshire, bug, dj)

name: mortshire
text: I love going to Borders with my friends and having Harlequin Recital Nite.  Good times.

name: heccibiggs
text: If I'm bored in town and I've got some time to kill, I'll go to a charity shop and head straight for the section with these books, and spend some time reading the blurbs. I usually have to stop myself from laughing out loud like a dork, but it's always worthwhile.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Wanna know what's even better than simply reading them?

Going to a bookstore with a couple friends and reenacting the poses on the covers.

name: rykan
text: ...This sounds like a worthwhile endeavor...

name: tonyhighwind
text:
Thank you, kelsotimebomb.

Thank you for planning my weekend.

Thank you.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i am definately doing this.

name: snowman
text:
I first read this as "Harlequin Rectal Night."

Make it happen.

name: epicurus
text: Wow, I'm an asshole.

text:
This one got a boost from the alt text: "Groaneesha lightly tapped the pewter wedding chalice. She had an announcement."

I mean, really. Groaneesha .

text:
Come on Cornelius.

You're better than this.

text: The Mini isn't just going to get a new clutch by itself, I'm afraid.

text: He can't hear you. He is in the oven.

text: ... how does a woman hold two rocks?

text: Usually with her hands.

text: Depends on whether she's feeling creative.

name: snowman
text: Practice.

name: clever-nickname
text:
Imagine an angel slapping pudding. Go on, I'll wait.

Marvelous, isn't it?

name: mattylite
text: Yes, it is. I'm gonna do it again.... yes. It is.

name: sirfrederick
text: The angel is probably Blister.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i think the pudding would taste better after having been slapped by an angel.

name: dasilodavi
text: That should be on the list of worst similes ever, right next to the one about the trash bag full of vegetable soup.

name: norrin
text: "McBride fell 12 stories, hitting the pavement like a Hefty Bag filled with vegetable soup."

name: aplomb
text: I don't know. That's pretty damn vivid.

name: tekende
text: "The boat floated across the water in exactly the way a bowling ball wouldn't."

name: rykan
text: That's almost Pratchett-esque in it's beauty.

name: mr_lostman28
text: does... does that mean it didn't float at all?

name: tekende
text: No. It floated just like a bowling ball would NOT.

name: machegav
text:
That line is a nigh-plagiaristic echo of a Douglas Adams line about Vogon ships.

If you knew this, I am dense, and deserve my fate.

If you didn't, that's eerie.

name: tekende
text:
It seems vaguely familiar. But the line came from a list that purported to be the most awful similes ever written by high school students, or something along those lines.

Another good one went something like "'Yes,' Alice moaned, her breasts heaving like a college freshman on dollar beer night."

name: echidnaboy
text:
"The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't."

Also .

text:
THAT'S the page!
my youth pastor once read that at my ute' group years and years ago. glad to have the whole thing at my disposal. fanfiction.net, you are mine

text: Oh holy shit, I've chubbied you after reading the very first one. Thank you.

text: Geez...he lent so much class to the Spice Channel with his captions, and that was on the fly. I guess even the ultimate badass has his limits.

name: deovalente
text: I imagine slapping pudding as an annoying, somewhat gross sound.  Then I think of an angel slapping pudding and I think that it is probably one of the most tranquil sounds I have ever imagined.

name: ctrl_z
text: So descriptive, it's like I'm there.

name: charchar
text: I know this sounds ridiculous but I will say it regardless . "Love My Way (The Psychedelic Furs) is on my stereo right now and your avatar is dancing in rhythm to it. Thank you.

name: tekende
text: That is an excellent song.

name: zathyr
text:
Like an angel slapping two hundred and forty dollars worth of pudding.
Awww yeah.

name: riotdejaneiro
text: An angel slapping pudding would be a lot louder than a rose falling to the ground. I mean they´re angels! with heavenly powers and stuff! I bet an angel would be one hell of a pudding-slapping beast. An earthquake <-- that´s what an angel slapping pudding would sound like

text: if an angel slapped pudding too hard, it would be splashing, instead.  an angel would hold back all but the most gentle of force in order to slap said pudding.

name: lolsworth
text: First thing I thought of after reading that: oh my God it's a Triangle and Robert slashfic. God, I'm pathetic.
